timeline.bodyText: This part: <<node.processors,allocated processors>> is more like: ((<<node.processors,allocated processors>> * 3) / 2) + 1. But perhaps we just refer to the search thread default size?
timeline.author: martijnvg
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -78,7 +78,8 @@ include::{docdir}/rest-api/common-parms.asciidoc[tag=index-ignore-unavailable]
 
 `max_concurrent_searches`::
 (Optional, integer)
-Maximum number of concurrent searches the multi search API can execute.

+to +max(1, (# of <<data-node,data nodes>> * min(# of <<node.processors,allocated processors>>, 10)))+.

replies.bodyText:
Good catch. I've replaced <<node.processors,allocated processors>> with <<search-threadpool,search thread pool size>> and added an appropriate anchor to the search thread pool definition.
Thanks @martijnvg!
